projects.title: Dark Matter Model Statistical Analysis
projects.subtitle: Bayesian Analysis of Milky Way Satellite Data
projects.description: Advanced constraints on **Warm Dark Matter** particle mass to `>4 keV/c²` through *Bayesian statistical analysis* of Milky Way satellite galaxy data, doubling previous research bounds.
projects.extendedDescription:
Conducted comprehensive **Bayesian statistical analysis** of Milky Way satellite galaxy data using high-performance Python framework with Monte Carlo integration.

### Key Achievements

- Optimized computational bottlenecks achieving **100x runtime improvement**
- Doubled previous research bounds on WDM particle mass
- Authored detailed research methods with full GitHub reproducibility

### Technical Implementation

```python
# Monte Carlo integration for likelihood computation
def compute_likelihood(params, data):
    """Compute Bayesian likelihood for WDM constraints"""
    return mcmc_sampler.evaluate(params, satellite_data)
```

> "This work represents a significant advancement in our understanding of dark matter physics and computational astrophysics." - Research Supervisor
projects.impact: Advanced particle mass constraints to >4 keV/c², doubling previous research bounds with 100x performance improvement
